captions.text:
Now we can watch all these shows we missed
while you were gone.
Walt poisoned that kid, you know.
Look at his hands, he keeps smelling them.

He washed them like he does after a meth cook,
but he's not used to the natural smell of flowers.

Also he had a botanic encyclopedia in his
bedroom and there were several shots-

-of a "Lily of the Vally" hidden throughout the
episode.
Look at how he answers the phone.

He looks at the door before, and his voice
goes up when he talks.
He thinks it's someone specific, but not his wife.

Notice his face, it's got sleep wrinkles on
the other side.

It means he slept on the side of the bed he's
not used to.

Also his smoke carton is one cigarette shorter,
it means he smoked one more than usual.

He doesn't look stressed, so it obviously
means he had sex.
Nick and Jess won't make it

He's the killer, She's the mother, They were
dead all along.

Sherlock! Can you "deduct" how much I hate
watching TV with you!?!

I want you to turn off the tv and
come to bed.

comments.text:
"I want you to turn off the TV and come to bed."
"Oh. OH."

As a serious Johnlock shipper this was my favorite part﻿

comments.author: Tate Thurgood

comments.text:
I don't ship Watson and Sherlock, as Watson is happily married and Sherlock 
is celibate, and a virgin obsessed with detective work.....he goes nuts if 
he doesn't have a case to work on. Besides, the running gag in Sherlock is 
that people thought those two were gay....(Even Mrs. Hudson) the humor is 
that they aren't. That and Sherlock's reaction to Irene  (not at first of 
course, but later on) suggests he is straight, but not good at processing 
emotion or relationships.

But I think it's HILAROUS how he spoils T.V. He's right, of course, most 
T.V. is terribly formulaic....I actually wouldn't mind hanging out with 
him, if he wanted. But he's such a hard person to befriend......

Yeah, I'm not annoyed by Sherlock's personality.....probably cause I have 
shades of it from time to time.﻿
